Australia: The decision was made to site the national capital in New South Wales, but not within 100 miles of Sydney. Queensland's offer of troops for the Second Boer War is accepted by the Imperial Government. The New South Wales Lancers arrived in Cape Town from London to begin Australia's participation in the Second Boer War. The Australian contingent to the Boer War departs Albany on the Medic. The Australian Labor Party held office for a few days in Queensland, becoming the first trade union party to do so anywhere in the world. Western Australia enacted full women's suffrage.
Belgium:
Jules Vandenpeereboom replaces Paul de Smet de Naeyer as Prime Minister
Paul de Smet de Naeyer replaces Jules Vandenpeereboom as Prime Minister
Antoon Stillemans, bishop of Ghent, suspends Adolf Daens as a diocesan priest due to his political activism
Brazil: The First Republic of Acre is declared.
Cuba:
The Spanish colonial government withdraws and the last captain General Alfonso Jimenez Castellano hands over power to the North American Military Governor, General John Ruller Brooke.
Leonard Wood becomes U.S. Provisional Governor of Cuba.
France: Ã‰mile Loubet began his term as president of France.
Germany: Second Boer War: The South African Republic and the Orange Free State declared war on the United Kingdom.
Philippine: U.S. Pres. McKinley appoints the first Philippine Commission, known as the Schurman Commission
The Malolos Constitution is promulgated by Aguinaldo.

The Malolos Republic (First Republic) government, Asia's first republic, is inaugurated at Barasoain Church in Malolos, Bulacan; Emilio Aguinaldo takes his oath of office as the first President of the Philippines.
Hostilities break out between the Filipino and U.S. forces.
The US Senate ratifies the Treaty of Paris with Spain
La Justicia, Cebu province's first Filipino-owned newspaper, publishes its first issue.
The Schurman Commission arrives in Manila
Filipino forces under Gen. Gregorio del Pilar defeated the Americans in an encounter in Quingua (now Plaridel), Bulacan.
The country's first municipal election is held in Baliuag, Bulacan.
Filipino troops, led by Emilio Aguinaldo, recapture the Calumpit and Baliwag towns from the Americans.
General Vicente Alvarez establishes the Republic of Zamboanga.
Aguinaldo's moves face opposition from Apolinario Mabini and Antonio Luna
Siege of Baler ends after 11 months, with 35 surviving Spanish soldiers surrendered.
Pres. Aguinaldo moves the seat of government from San Isidro, Nueva Ecija to Tarlac Province.
Gregorio Del Pilar killed in the Battle of Tirad Pass.
An American base is attacked by the Filipinos in Vigan, Ilocos Sur.
Singapore:
Singapore Chinese Girls' School was established at 52 Hill Street.
Sir Charles Bullen Hugh Mitchell died while in the office as Governor of the Straits Settlements.
James Alexander Swettenham was appointed as the Acting Governor of the Straits Settlements.
Slovenia: The Maribor National Hall is built.
Taiwan:
The Bank of Taiwan established to encourage Japanese investment
Taiwanese are recruited as policemen after a lower rank is created
